medium_description_en: Screens for depression in the postnatal period.
instructions_en: Use this tool to screen for depression in the postpartum period. The original literature uses a cutoff score of 10 for a positive screen, as does our calculator. However, some studies and institutions use other cutoffs for a positive screen.

seo.meta_description_en: The Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS) screens for depression in the postnatal period.
seo.keywords_en: Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS), epds, postnatal depression, postpartum depression, depression

Validation.text: Cox JL, Chapman G, Murray D, Jones P. Validation of the edinburgh postnatal depression scale (Epds) in non-postnatal women. J Affect Disord. 1996;39(3):185-189.
Rubertsson C, Börjesson K, Berglund A, Josefsson A, Sydsjö G. The swedish validation of edinburgh postnatal depression scale (Epds) during pregnancy. Nord J Psychiatry. 2011;65(6):414-418.

Gibson J, McKenzie-McHarg K, Shakespeare J, Price J, Gray R. A systematic review of studies validating the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale in antepartum and postpartum women. Acta Psychiatr Scand. 2009;119(5):350-364.
Boyce P, Stubbs J, Todd A. The edinburgh postnatal depression scale: validation for an australian sample. Aust N Z J Psychiatry. 1993;27(3):472-476.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Cox JL, Holden JM, Sagovsky R. Detection of postnatal depression. Development of the 10-item edinburgh postnatal depression scale. Br J Psychiatry. 1987;150:782-786.

Other References.text: Levis B, Negeri Z, Sun Y, Benedetti A, Thombs BD, DEPRESsion Screening Data (DEPRESSD) EPDS Group. Accuracy of the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (Epds) for screening to detect major depression among pregnant and postpartum women: systematic review and meta-analysis of individual participant data. BMJ. 2020;371:m4022.

creator_info.about_en: John L. Cox, MD, is a clinical psychologist practicing in Jackson, Mississippi. Dr. Cox’s primary research is focused on depression, anxiety, addictions, OCD, and bipolar disorder.
